Type.Name: MemberAccessException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit MemberAccessException extends System.SystemException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: is the base class for exceptions that occurs when an attempt to locate or access a type member fails.

block.para: exceptions are typically thrown by the system when members in a class library have been changed or removed, and an assembly that references the class library has not been recompiled.
The Base Class Library includes the following derived types:
When appropriate, use these types instead of .

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Cannot access member." This message takes into account the current system culture.
The property of the new instance is initialized to .

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
